articles.headline: 4 Arrested in Schemes Said to Be Tied to JPMorgan Chase Breach
articles.snippet: Four men in Florida and Israel were arrested in connection with investment schemes that were said to be related to a cyberattack at JPMorgan Chase.
articles.abstract: Four men in Florida and Israel were arrested in connection with investment schemes that were said to be related to a cyberattack at JPMorgan Chase.
articles.lead_paragraph: A huge computer attack against JPMorgan Chase last summer may have been more of an attempt to fuel an ongoing pump-and-dump stock scheme rather than an effort to steal financial data from the nation’s biggest bank.

articles.headline: Innovation Sputters in Battle Against Climate Change
articles.snippet: Reports painting bleak pictures of the future show that the world’s clean energy efforts are falling short.
articles.abstract: Reports painting bleak pictures of the future show that the world’s clean energy efforts are falling short.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the race to develop technologies to slow climate change, the world is off track.

articles.headline: Apple Profit Up 38%, but iPhone Sales Disappoint Wall Street
articles.snippet: While the quarter’s phone sales were one-third higher than a year ago, at 47.5 million, they fell short of analysts’ estimates, and the stock fell.
articles.abstract: While the quarter’s phone sales were one-third higher than a year ago, at 47.5 million, they fell short of analysts’ estimates, and the stock fell.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even when Apple jumps, investors wonder why the company can’t jump a bit higher.

articles.headline: Health Care Tax Faces United Opposition From Labor and Employers
articles.snippet: The so-called Cadillac tax, to be imposed starting in 2018 on plans costing over a certain amount, is prompting companies and unions to come together to call for its repeal.
articles.abstract: The so-called Cadillac tax, to be imposed starting in 2018 on plans costing over a certain amount, is prompting companies and unions to come together to call for its repeal.
articles.lead_paragraph: At the paper mill in Longview, Wash., Kurt Gallow and his wife, Brenda, are worrying about his company’s proposed new health care plan, which would require workers to pay as much as $6,000 toward their families’ medical bills.

articles.headline: Obama’s Plan for Guantánamo Is Seen Faltering
articles.snippet: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter has not committed to administration proposals to send prisoners to other locations.
articles.abstract: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter has not committed to administration proposals to send prisoners to other locations.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama is enjoying a winning streak lately, with the Supreme Court reaffirming his signature health care law and Iran agreeing to curbs on its nuclear program. But one longstanding goal continues to bedevil him: closing the wartime prison at Guantánamo Bay, Cuba.

articles.headline: Limits at Gawker? Rules at Reddit? Wild West Web Turns a Page
articles.snippet: The digital media companies are struggling with a tough transition — from underfunded start-ups to mature businesses.
articles.abstract: The digital media companies are struggling with a tough transition — from underfunded start-ups to mature businesses.
articles.lead_paragraph: Facing the abrupt resignations of two of his top editors on Monday and a potential revolt inside his newsroom, Gawker Media’s founder and chief executive, Nick Denton, tapped out a long memo to his editorial staff.

articles.headline: Titans Clash as Donald Trump’s Run Fuels His Feud With Rupert Murdoch
articles.snippet: Donald J. Trump holds the lead in Republican polls, but he has already lost the man who controls many of the nation’s most important news outlets.
articles.abstract: Donald J. Trump holds the lead in Republican polls, but he has already lost the man who controls many of the nation’s most important news outlets.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the rarefied world of New York moguls, Rupert Murdoch never thought much of Donald J. Trump.
articles.byline: By Amy Chozick and Ashley Parker

articles.headline: With Planned Parenthood Videos, Activist Ignites Abortion Issue
articles.snippet: David Daleiden has provoked a storm with his video stings alleging that Planned Parenthood clinics are selling tissue from aborted fetuses for profit, a charge the group denies.
articles.abstract: David Daleiden has provoked a storm with his video stings alleging that Planned Parenthood clinics are selling tissue from aborted fetuses for profit, a charge the group denies.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON —  David Daleiden would only reluctantly talk about himself: “I don’t think I’m the story,” he said by phone on Tuesday. But he is the man behind the story and the hidden camera — the anti-abortion activist who has provoked a storm with his video stings alleging that Planned Parenthood clinics are selling tissue from aborted fetuses for profit, a charge the group denies.

articles.headline: Bill Cosby Legal Team Complains of ‘Smear’
articles.snippet: It was Mr. Cosby’s first public defense since parts of his deposition in a 2005 lawsuit became public this month.
articles.abstract: It was Mr. Cosby’s first public defense since parts of his deposition in a 2005 lawsuit became public this month.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bill Cosby’s lawyers fought back Tuesday, asserting in a legal filing that he has been damaged by news media accounts that they said inaccurately portrayed him as having testified that he used powerful sedatives to drug women so he could molest them.

articles.headline: Afghan Security Forces Struggle Just to Maintain Stalemate
articles.snippet: With months of heavy fighting still ahead, 2015 is already shaping up to be worse than last year for the Afghan Army and the national police.
articles.abstract: With months of heavy fighting still ahead, 2015 is already shaping up to be worse than last year for the Afghan Army and the national police.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — After suffering setbacks and heavy casualties at the hands of the Taliban in 2014, Afghan security forces came into this year with what Afghan and Western officials acknowledge were relatively modest goals: hang on till the end of the fighting season without major collapses.

articles.headline: A Find in Britain: Quran Fragments Perhaps as Old as Islam
articles.snippet: The pieces of the manuscript, which were found in the library of the University of Birmingham, are probably at least 1,370 years old, researchers say.
articles.abstract: The pieces of the manuscript, which were found in the library of the University of Birmingham, are probably at least 1,370 years old, researchers say.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The ancient manuscript, written on sheep or goat skin, sat for nearly a century at a university library, with scholars unaware of its significance.

articles.headline: Celebrated Bass-Baritone Plans a Surprise Debut at Conducting
articles.snippet: Thomas Quasthoff will direct Bach's monumental "St. Matthew Passion" at the Verbier Festival.
articles.abstract: Thomas Quasthoff will direct Bach's monumental "St. Matthew Passion" at the Verbier Festival.
articles.lead_paragraph: VERBIER, Switzerland — It was a sad day for the classical music world, in 2012, when the great German bass-baritone Thomas Quasthoff announced his retirement from the concert stage at 52. Blessed with a rich, strong, beautiful voice, Mr. Quasthoff not only had established a major career against seemingly insuperable odds, but also had risen to the top of his profession.

articles.headline: China Targeting Rights Lawyers in a Crackdown
articles.snippet: More than 200 lawyers and associates have been detained on accusations of exploiting cases to enrich themselves and to attack the Communist Party.
articles.abstract: More than 200 lawyers and associates have been detained on accusations of exploiting cases to enrich themselves and to attack the Communist Party.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — More than 200 lawyers and associates have been detained, with 20 still in custody. Some have been paraded on television making humiliating confessions or portrayed as rabble-rousing thugs. A blast of commentaries in newspapers run by the Communist Party has accused them of subversion and swindles.
articles.byline: By Andrew Jacobs and Chris Buckley

articles.headline: In Apple Watch Debut, Signs of a Familiar Path to Success
articles.snippet: Some technology pundits have declared the device a flop, but Apple has a history of using incremental improvements to make its products indispensable.
articles.abstract: Some technology pundits have declared the device a flop, but Apple has a history of using incremental improvements to make its products indispensable.
articles.lead_paragraph: Asking if the Apple Watch will become a hit or a flop is a bit like asking if my 2-year-old daughter is destined to go to Yale or to jail. Interested parties can speculate on the basis of thin evidence — she learned to walk pretty early, though on the other hand, she still thinks cats say “bow wow” — but youth is inherently unpredictable, and anyone venturing a long-term forecast based on short-term performance runs the risk of looking quite silly.
